meanings.definition: A person who buys goods or services for resale.
meanings.sent1: The compradores at the market purchased fresh fruits to sell at their own stores.
meanings.sent2: The local store owner was a comprador who bought products in bulk to resell at a profit.
meanings.sent3: The group of compradores decided to host a competition to see who could sell the most items in a day.
meanings.sent4: She was a skilled comprador, able to spot valuable items to purchase for later resale.
meanings.sent5: The young entrepreneur learned the tricks of the trade from experienced compradores in the industry.

meanings.definition: A person who acts as an intermediary in business transactions.
meanings.sent1: The compradores facilitated communication between the two companies during the negotiation.
meanings.sent2: As a trusted comprador, he helped bridge the gap between the two parties in the deal.
meanings.sent3: The compradores organized a team-building activity to strengthen their bond with the clients.
meanings.sent4: In the world of business, a skilled comprador can make or break a successful partnership.
meanings.sent5: The role of a comprador is crucial in ensuring smooth transactions between businesses.
